pages.text: $(#d22857)$(l)【Scarlet Silken Gown】$()$(br2)“The swaying flower shadow beneath the moonlight—an unhealed wound of the slumbering war god.”$(br2)These silk-like crimson petals are often mistaken for common poppies, yet hidden within their core lies a six-pointed star-shaped inky-black pattern. Their stems secrete a milky-white sap with hallucinogenic properties, which medieval alchemists once called ‘The Lip Rouge of the Nightmare Goddess.’
Highly adaptable, found across nearly all biomes except the most extreme environments. Wherever sunlight and soil meet, these flowers may bloom.

Excerpt from a wandering alchemist’s parchment:$(br)On the night of the seventh lunar eclipse, I buried nine poppies at the northern edge of the graveyard. When the last petal was soaked in morning dew, a mist-blue spectral horse rose from the soil. In their hollow sockets, ever-blooming flowers took root.$(br2)Has anyone else tried this?

Gently roasted poppy petals are steeped in a silver crucible, extracting a deep crimson tea with a pearlescent sheen. As it flows down the throat, warmth surges through the veins, as if life itself is awakening.$(br2)$(#BF2812)Beautiful yet dangerous.$(br)That night, I saw my own decaying face reflected in the tea—yet the reflection in the mirror began to smile…$()
